meanings.def: a printed piece of paper, or a message or image received on your phone or computer, that gives you the right to travel on a particular bus, train, etc. or to go into a theatre, etc.
examples: a plane/bus/train ticket
an airline ticket
a theatre/concert ticket
ticket for/to something free tickets to the show
I bought a ticket for the concert.
I booked a one-way ticket to Montreal.
Tickets are available from the Arts Centre at £5.00.
a one-way/return ticket
a ticket office
a ticket holder (= a person who has a ticket)
a ticket machine/collector/inspector
They raised over £40,000 in ticket sales alone.
Ticket prices range from $9 for adults to $4.75 for children.
Tickets can also be purchased by phone.
(figurative) She hoped that getting this job would finally be her ticket to success.
by ticket Admission is by ticket only.
Concessionary tickets are available at half the standard price.
He showed the guard his ticket.
I've got complimentary tickets for the theatre.
Phone the ticket line on this number.
Use the coupon below to reserve advance tickets for the exhibition.
You must hold a valid ticket before boarding the train.
a first-class rail ticket
a ticket for Saturday

meanings.def: a printed piece of paper with a number or numbers on it, that you buy in order to have the chance of winning a prize if the number or numbers are later chosen
examples: a lottery/raffle ticket
There are three winning tickets.
I own a little store that sells lottery tickets.
Raffle tickets cost just $10.

meanings.def: a label that is attached to something in a shop giving details of its price, size, etc.
an official notice that orders you to pay a fine because you have done something illegal while driving or parking your car
examples: a speeding ticket
The police officer gave us a ticket for going through a red light.

meanings.def: a list of candidates that are supported by a particular political party in an election
examples: She ran for office on the Democratic ticket.
I generally vote a split ticket.
I'm voting the straight Republican ticket.
There are three candidates on the national ticket.
There had been talk of Kennedy dropping LBJ from the ticket in '64.

meanings.def: a request for a problem to be fixed that is entered into a system that manages such requests
examples: Open a ticket with the Help Desk.
It's tickets for the team that loses.

meanings.def: exactly what is needed in a particular situation
examples: That cup of tea was just the ticket.

meanings.def: to vote for candidates from more than one party
used to say that something is just what is needed or that everything is just right
examples: Are we all packed and ready to go? That’s the ticket.
It's tickets for the team that loses.

idioms.def: exactly what is needed in a particular situation
examples: That cup of tea was just the ticket.

idioms.def: to vote for candidates from more than one party
used to say that something is just what is needed or that everything is just right
examples: Are we all packed and ready to go? That’s the ticket.

meanings.def: to produce and sell tickets for an event, a trip, etc.; to give somebody a ticket
examples: be ticketed Passengers can now be ticketed electronically.

meanings.def: to give somebody an official notice that orders them to pay a fine because they have done something illegal while driving or parking a car
examples: be ticketed Park illegally, and you're likely to be ticketed.
